options.name: Gaussian-peak throughput + U-shaped latency (chosen)
options.approach: Parametric synthetic curves: log-growth with Gaussian decay for throughput; asymmetric quadratic for latency.
cons: Not derived from a specific consensus model

options.name: Queueing-theory inspired (M/M/1+quorum)
options.approach: Model service rate as function of authorities and quorum threshold; latency from Little's law.
cons: Harder to explain and tune for demos

options.name: Piecewise linear with peak and slopes
options.approach: Growth segment up to peak then linear decay; latency mirrored with V-shape.

options.name: Simulation-driven stubs
options.approach: Run a lightweight simulator to produce data; use placeholders when unavailable.

rationale: Matches the user's qualitative description with tunable peak at ~50 authorities, minimal parameters, and smooth plots.
